content.name: Freelance Web Developer
content.title: Web Developer
content.description: Wordpress, EJS, jQuery, CreateJS, Static HTML, Email Templates, Heroku, GA

content.name: Acidotic Racing
content.title: Web Developer

content.name: PICA Manufacturing Solutions
content.title: Web Developer

content.name: Central Midori
content.title: Web Developer
content.description: S3, CloudFront, EC2. Static HTML with Gulp and hosted Wordpress for Blog.

content.name: Marilinda Garcia for Congress
content.title: Web Developer
content.description: My primary role with this campaign is to create a website where voters have access to latest news, social media links and general campaign information. Other responsibilities include: graphic design, photo editing and logo design.

content.name: Startup Institute
content.title: Product & Design
content.description: Selected by Startup Institute in a highly competitive process to attend an intensive training program focused on developing the core skills in product & design to have a meaningful and positive influence on a startup's objectives. - HTML, CSS, jQuery and Javascript - Product Management - Responsive Design - Organizing a Design Project - User Centered Design & Whiteboarding - Wireframing & Rapid Prototyping - Typography

references.title: Nice things people had to say

content.name: Winfield Trail
content.title: Lead Programmer, Paint Nite d/b/a Yaymaker, worked with Stephen at Paint Nite
content.content: Stephen is one of my most valued colleagues, and nobody can bang out CSS faster or better than him. In his time with PaintNite, Stephen has successfully evangelized technologies like Less, Gulp, and Angular, which alongside his spectacular problem-solving ability have radically improved every aspect of our product. It is my privilege to work with Mr. Young, so much that I can overlook his barbaric preference for soft tab indentation when editing HTML. He is a consummate team player: even though in terms of capability, he is an army of one.

content.name: Katelyn Friedson
content.title: Product Manager, worked with Stephen at Paint Nite d/b/a Yaymaker
content.content: I have worked with few developers who are as knowledgeable, passionate and effective at creating beautiful and engaging user experiences as Stephen has at Paint Nite. Stephen is not only highly skilled and agile, but he also has excellent people, communication and leadership skills which make him a pleasure to work with, and an invaluable part of any web team. As lead developer at Paint Nite, Stephen not only demonstrates a mastery of web technologies, but also a commanding grasp and deep understanding of business goals and cross-functional initiatives. Stephen has been a key contributor to the success of Paint Nite's 'Next Gen' product launch, and has been a valued and respected member of the organization. On a personal level, Stephen has a great sense of humor, contagious creative energy, and has lots of hidden artistic talents. :)

content.name: Ryan McDonald
content.title: Full Stack Developer, Vsnap, worked directly with Stephen at Vsnap
content.content: Stephen is a passionate, driven and talented developer. His love for programming is clearly visible in his tireless dedication to a project and his artistic abilities and creativity only add to his effectiveness as a front end web developer. Stephen and I first worked together when he was brought on as an interim-developer at Vsnap while he planned a move from Boston, MA to Austin, TX. He quickly picked up AngularJS (a front end framework that was new to him) and demonstrated so much ambition that he was hired as a full time front end dev despite the fact that he would be moving and have to work remotely. As a member of the Vsnap dev team Stephen was always happy to pick up any task that needed doing and never shy about working on things that were outside of his comfort zone. He as always very helpful if I ever had a question and very open to discussion when deciding the best way to tackle a problem. I would highly recommend Stephen and would love to work with again if the opportunity presented itself.

content.name: Dave McLaughlin
content.title: CEO & Co-Founder, Vsnap, managed Stephen indirectly at Vsnap
content.content: Stephen is super talented and hard working, and he's also just a wonderful guy and an amazing team member. He has the creative spirit of an artist and the work ethic of a coal miner. Absolutely a guy who amplifies the energy and brings great things to any team. He brought so much to our product at Vsnap, and it's a true pleasure to recommend him.

content.name: Niksa Janjic
content.title: Developer, Vsnap, worked directly with Stephen at Vsnap
content.content: Stephen is a talented Frontend developer who also has a keen eye for design. As a developer at Vsnap he worked on a frontend part of the app developing in Angular. He is very fast at delivering new features and rewrote whole HTML/CSS part of the app to optimize it and improve it noticeably. He is capable of making pages from scratch, creating beautiful designs straight from the head. He also wrote lots and refactored most of unit-tests with a coverage over 90%, created bunch of directives to reduce boilerplate code and made sure all pages are responsive and work cross-browser. He usually reviewed my code and gave me ideas and advices how to improve it and made sure it is optimized and minimal as possible.

content.name: Nathan Levesque
content.title: Lead Software Developer, Vsnap, managed Stephen indirectly at Vsnap
content.content: Stephen is a strong front end developer who doesn't hesitate to dive in and learn backend services for feature implementation and bug fixes. Recently, Stephen put in a great deal of effort to identify and fix some deficiencies with our Jasmine-based front end tests which enabled the tests to be much more stable. Stephen is very talented in taking web designs from a designer and implementing them in a page with responsive design. In particular he has greatly refactored the Vsnap application's CSS to eliminate duplication and improve page load times.

content.name: Guillaume Delloue
content.title: Director of Marketing, Vsnap, worked directly with Stephen at Vsnap
content.content: Stephen is a talented front-end developer with an immense appetite for learning and improving his skills. I can guarantee he'll be in the top 10% of the most productive developers in any organization. He's also a team player who's sensitive to the needs of other departments (marketing, sales, support etc.). Combined with his friendly demeanor and positive attitude Stephen is that rare dev talent any tech company would want to have. I highly recommend him.

content.name: Christopher Swenor
content.content: It was amazing watch Stephen grow into what he is today. He started off as a Junior Developer and has grown into a developer that I can truly trust to make the right decisions. He has passion for JavaScript, and shows it in his work ethic. Vsnap is a better product because we found Stephen. He is extremely creative, and a pleasure to work with. I would do it again any chance I get.
content.title: CTO, Vsnap, managed Stephen at Vsnap

content.name: Brad Stevens
content.content: Stephen did a tremendous job detailing the essential components of the campaign's website and putting it together in a way that was visually stunning and easy to navigate. Stephen is great to work with and very responsive. I would highly recommend Stephen to any candidate, business or organization looking to make their digital mark.
content.title: worked directly with Stephen at Marilinda Garcia for Congress

other.title: Other things I've learned or used

Standing over a workbench using a biscuit joiner

Painting a DIY Chicken Coop project
Planting apple trees with my son
Up close photo of my lawn
Adding more soil to our potatoe mounds.
Planting grass with my two kids
Fresh picked radishes from the garden

highlight.title: Employment Highlight
highlight.header: Paint Nite, LLC d/b/a Yaymaker, Somerville, MA — May 2015 - Feb 2020
roles: Software Engineer, Front End — May 2015 - May 2016
highlight.focus: React, Flow, Redux, Apollo, GraphQl, Storybook, Webpack, Enzyme, A/B testing, HTML, SCSS

content.title: Rewrite of main web app from Java/AngularJS to NodeJS/ReactJS/GraphQL
content: Releasing incremental changes - page by page. This allowed for a safer and smoother transition
Localized content for three separate locales
More extensive Google Analytics tracking, powered through Tealium
Executed an innovative search design which highlights both landscape and portrait paintings in a natural way
Implemented “Quick-View” to allow users to see more details without leaving the page
Added a “map-view” with custom pins and info windows
Used a pinterest-style grid layout

content.title: Developed an in-house, server-side rendered, A/B Testing platform
content: No flicker or custom CSS needed
Connected to Google Analytics Reporting
$600k annualized lift with one of our first tests. (New filter design)

content.title: Created an ability to switch between Paint Nite and Plant Nite brands
content: Used/Created a shared Components NPM repo
Custom copy, assets and styling

content.title: Worked with the Project Manager to define the development process, using Kanban as the core (and later Scrum)
content: Creating new ticket types
Improved our swimlanes and meetings

content.title: Implemented Storybook to showcase our component library allowing developers and designers easy access for use.
content: Uses NPM
4 separate apps use these components
100% code coverage with Jest and Enzyme

content.title: TODO: _Cross speciality learning_
content: Unblocked myself by picking up various server side work: GraphQl, Sequelize, and DB migrations for example. Which after a short while, I ended up being just as valuable as the rest of the team across all areas.

content.title: Building the team
content: Helped with hiring, phone screens, interviews, code challenges, and resume reviews

content.title: Backstage Reskin (Our user facing admin application)
content: Latest react/apollo/flow - hooks
Faster to spin out pages
Ant Design

content.title: Brought unit testing to our client projects
content: Enzyme/Jest/Chai

content.title: Part of a large rebrand of the company
content: moving a codebase that was set up to work with two domains, with two brands, down to a single site with a different domain and brand than the originals.

content.title: Dev Coop
content: Deployment slack integration and site/apis status
Code Coverage on our js apps
We had issues with deploying - most likely like everyone else
Flask
- Releases -
JIRA, Bitbucket and Slack APIs
Automatically grab upcoming releases, match them with jira tickets, link them to BB prs for merging

Button clicks send messages and questions to slack channels that follows the steps to release - the app/bot needs approval (custom based on what is being released - matched devs with repos to pick who is needed for approval)
Posts status updates during deployment
Posts next deployment plans and steps
Provides an automatic rollback plan
Lists of releases, statuses, steps
View previous releases

content.title: Mandrill Email App(s)
content: Before we had zero source control and only disorganized and often broken html files
Gulp / Flask (Python) / Mandrill API
Ability to spin up emails visible on all clients very quickly
Shared partial files like headers, footers, images
Imported the styleguide from the main website via npm
Template previewer with mock data (vs random templating strings)
Keycloak with roles and then later, Auth0
Source control
Deployable with docker, hosted app that allows developers and QA to view and test with custom variables on any environment. Ability to publish a draft or live on any env. develop/staging/prod
Integrated with deployments which was now safer and easier - with the ability to roll back changes if needed.

content.title: Analytics
content: shared library
unit tested
Graphql partials ensured all data needed was retrieved
Shared among many apps
Great configuration makes it simple to update how the data is transposed

content.title: Elastic Search
content: Brought more use to our search page
Fuzzy matching and autocomplete. Able to search against many different resource types
Setup tools for the team to easily update/copy/remove/etc our indices and migrate data up/down environments
Worked to replace Google Maps Places API with in-house ES version which decreased API costs by approximately $87,000 yearly

content.title: SEO
content: Site cleanup with easier quick fixes like meta tags, alt tags, Hx’s, etc.
Generated sitemap since our events were ephemeral
Created a shared URLs package with graphql partials that ensure our urls were always canonical, and this was shared amongst many clients
Middleware for inactive landing pages (artists, events, etc..) so that we could properly redirect (avoiding 404)

Screaming Frog: Minimized redirects / Identified broken links / Identified use of Hx’S / Robots.txt / Identified missing meta tags - built a component to handle this dynamically. Used NPM package to handle UGC links rel=”ugc nofollow”

content.title: Site Performance
content: Image size / Image rendering tool
Alt tags / Needed sizes / Optimized all the images on our site with manual insert / Project images, venues, host, and could be used for heroes, logs, etc.
Code Splitting
Critical CSS
HTTP Requests
S3/Cloudfront caching
GtMetrix
Lambda function to assist with SEO objectives / Minifying / Self-hosting / Slack integration / 3rd party vendor scripts
Audit of code for bundle bloat / Webpack / Removing duplicate or bloated node modules
Nightwatch E2E tests
